children.text:
- Multi-warehouse inventory management
- Supplier and product tracking
- Purchase order creation for out-of-stock products
- Purchase order confirmation for received products
- Warehouse stock transfer management

This inventory management template is a software product designed to help businesses manage their inventory efficiently. The system allows users to manage products and stock across multiple warehouses, as well as track supplier products and manage suppliers.

To start using this template in a new environment, the first step is to set up a PostgreSQL database. You can choose any provider you prefer, such as supabase. It's not necessary to configure the data at this point, just set up a new postgres instance and get the accesss credentials

To complete the setup process, you need to update all queries in every page to use your newly created datasource instead of the default Mock_DB_V2 datasource. This means going through each page and making the necessary modifications to the queries to ensure they are pulling data from the correct source.
Now that you have set up your database, it is currently empty without any tables, configuration, or data. Here is a database schema diagram that you can refer to
To get started, add your new datasource to the list of datasources and then execute the setupDB query on the newly added datasource
